poem:
### Ink on Paper

In a printer's forgotten hum, echoes of power,  
Leaders' shadows glide across the tundra,  
Leaflets floated on geopolitical winds,  
Bearing demands like flurried snow—  
A theater of ambition, staged on blank pages,  
Where ink smears map out futures,  
Yet mountains hold their breath, stone-faced,  
As generals talk in empty rooms, alone.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Putin demands full control of Donetsk and Luhansk as condition for ending Ukraine war – live 8.46pm BST US summit plans left in hotel printer in Anchorage before Trump-Putin meeting – report Eight pages of US government planning documents for the summit meeting between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin were left in a hotel printer in Anchorage before the meeting on Friday, NPR reports. The documents, which were posted online by NPR, appear to have". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
